parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To place (put) to, add; I do again. From pros and tithemi; to place additionally, i.e. Lay beside, annex, repeat.
Accusative case of charis as preposition; through favor of, i.e. On account of.
A transgression, overstepping, deviation. From parabaino; violation.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To give orders to, prescribe, arrange. From dia and tasso; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. institute, prescribe, etc.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From mesos; a go-between, i.e. an internunciator, or a reconciler.
